page.title: 04BIRD AVIARIES/LILFORD PARK 1
page.content: Lilford Park is renown for its collection of birds. The aviaries are surrounded by the grounds of Lilford Hall, owned by Lord Lilford. He has always been very keen on birds and so has collected these marvellous creatures over the years .The collection ranges from European buzzards and rheas from South America to parakeets from Asia and flamingoes from South America. The park has a pinetum which has two small lakes on which there are breeding more than one hundred wildfowl representing sixteen species. The main attraction of Lilford Park are the aviaries which were created between 1860-1890 by the Fourth Baron Lilford. Under the guidance of the present Lord Lilford,the aviaries and flamingo pool have been restored and restocked. <See page 5>
